headline: Cannes Lions Grand Prix Winner Justin Kramm Launches Shitshow Creative to Turn LOL Into ROI for Bold Brands
summary: Justin Kramm, a Cannes Grand Prix-winning creative director whose career includes global campaigns for Nike, Red Bull, Intel, and Microsoft, has launched Shitshow Creative, a global collective of comedians, filmmakers, and designers helping mission-driven brands tell stories people actually want to watch.

raw.headline: Cannes Lions Grand Prix Winner Justin Kramm Launches Shitshow Creative to Turn LOL Into ROI for Bold Brands
raw.summary: Justin Kramm, a Cannes Grand Prix-winning creative director whose career includes global campaigns for Nike, Red Bull, Intel, and Microsoft, has launched Shitshow Creative, a global collective of comedians, filmmakers, and designers helping mission-driven brands tell stories people actually want to watch.

headline: Sportswear brand On launches South Korea robot factory
summary: STORY: This factory in Busan, South Korea, is where sportswear brand On Running is using 32 robots to make its running shoes, in a push to speed up both manufacturing and delivery.The Swiss company said it's planning to open robot factories like this in the United States and Europe, too, as tariff hikes, supply chain disruptions and geopolitical risks are driving brands to manufacture their products closer to the end consumer.:: ROBOTS AT WORKIn a fierce competition with bigger rivals like Nike and Adidas to produce the fastest marathon running shoe, On has marketed its "LightSpray" shoe as a gamechanger for its lightness.The shoe is made with a robot arm spraying material onto a mold to create a sock-like design.COPPETTI: “The game changer will be making this product anywhere in the world close to consumer.”On's co-founder Caspar Coppetti says automation enables the brand to make shoes faster and closer to its key markets, and with less environmental impact.:: Caspar Coppetti, Co-founder, OnCOPPETTI: “I think the speed to market and the sustainability of it and also the fact that basically we're running out of places with cheap labor are all speaking for automation and get going closer to where consumers are.”According to its latest annual report, On currently sources 90% of its shoes from third-party manufacturers in Vietnam and 10% from Indonesia.On said planned robot factories in the U.S. would help lessen its tariff costs.COPPETTI: "I believe in free trade and so you know the more clarity we can get around tariffs and not having tariffs at all, I think will be beneficial for On.”Steep tariffs imposed by the U.S. on sportswear manufacturing hubs like Vietnam and China have weighed heavily on the industry over the past year, driving up production costs and squeezing margins.Now, the Supreme Court's ruling against tariffs has added fresh uncertainty, further clouding the outlook for retailers and importers.

raw.headline: Sportswear brand On launches South Korea robot factory

headline: After stints at Nike and Kohl’s, Elevance Health’s CDIO pivots to using tech to bring more ‘delight’ to health care
summary: Ratnakar Lavu spent most of his career working at major retailers. Here's why Lavu thinks his experience can bring 'delight' to the healthcare sector.

headline: Luma AI Assembles Star-Studded Jury for $1M Cannes Lions Competition
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., February 25, 2026--Luma AI today announced the jury for The Luma Dream Brief, its global creative competition offering $1 million.

headline: Nike signs agreement to power Japan operations with solar energy
summary: The athletic footwear and apparel brand’s Japan subsidiary has signed a virtual power purchase agreement with Mitsui & Co., which will supply Nike with clean electricity for its operations.

raw.headline: Nike signs agreement to power Japan operations with solar energy
raw.summary: The athletic footwear and apparel brand’s Japan subsidiary has signed a virtual power purchase agreement with Mitsui & Co., which will supply Nike with clean electricity for its operations.

headline: Is NIKE Stock Underperforming the S&P 500?

headline: Here’s Why Madison Large Cap Fund Chose to Exit Nike (NKE)
